title: Request for Records: Arrest of Jason Zubia & Monica Almanza – Package Theft Scheme (Horizon City PD)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of all public records related to the arrest of Jason Zubia (44) and Monica Almanza (46) by the Horizon City Police Department in March 2025. The arrests are related to a package theft and drug investigation involving UPS shipments and boxes of stolen property. According to reports, both individuals were arrested at Zubia’s residence in East El Paso.

Please include:

Police reports

Arrest affidavits

Body-worn camera footage

911 dispatch calls

Booking information

Property/evidence inventory logs

Any related investigative documents

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Records – March 23, 2025 Incident Involving Juvenile Aggravated Assault – Harris County, TX

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to a juvenile aggravated assault incident that occurred in Houston, Texas, on or about Sunday, March 23, 2025, involving three teenage sisters ages 14, 15, and 16. The case was reported by ABC13 and the Harris County Sheriff's Office.

According to reports, the teens allegedly attacked their mother inside their home after she turned off the Wi-Fi. One of the teens struck the mother with a brick, and their grandmother was reportedly knocked down while trying to protect the victim.

All three teens were arrested and booked into the Harris County Juvenile Facility, charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.

I am requesting:

Initial offense and arrest reports

Incident call logs and dispatch audio

Any available body-worn camera or dashcam footage

Booking information for the juveniles (if releasable under Texas law)

Any supplemental reports or affidavits filed in relation to the incident

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Records – Arrest of Michael Anthony Montoya Jr. on March 17, 2025 – Texas DPS

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to the arrest of Michael Anthony Montoya Jr., a 35-year-old male from San Juan, Texas, who was arrested by the Texas Department of Public Safety on or about March 17, 2025, in Cameron County, Texas.

According to media reports, DPS attempted to stop a black 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokee on SH 4 in Brownsville. The driver allegedly refused to stop, leading to a chase and crash at an intersection. Troopers then reportedly located eight plastic-wrapped bundles of marijuana in the vehicle's cargo area. The bundles weighed an estimated 200 pounds.

Montoya was charged with evading arrest and felony possession of marijuana. He was booked into the Cameron County Jail.

I am requesting the following records:

Arrest and offense reports

Dashcam and/or body-worn camera footage from DPS troopers involved

911 call audio or dispatch communications

Booking and intake records

Any supplemental or investigative reports related to the arrest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Records – Arrest of Kailey Ruckman on March 27, 2025 – Shallowater PD

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting public records related to the arrest of Kailey Ruckman, a 35-year-old woman who was taken into custody by the Shallowater Police Department following a domestic violence incident that occurred on or around March 27, 2025.

According to reports, officers responded to a call at a residence near East FM Rd. 1294 and Ave U. Ruckman was accused of stabbing her husband in the neck while he was asleep. She was arrested and booked into the Lubbock County Detention Center and is charged with aggravated assault against a family member. The victim sustained serious injuries.

I am seeking the following records:

Arrest report and affidavit

Incident/offense report

Body-worn camera and/or dashcam footage from responding officers

911 call audio and CAD logs

Booking information and mugshot

Any supplemental documentation related to this arrest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Records Request – Arrest of Malcom Grant (Dallas, TX) on March 19, 2025 in McCracken County

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Malcom Grant, a 27-year-old male from Dallas, Texas, who was taken into custody by the McCracken County Sheriff’s Office on March 19, 2025, around 11:13 PM, following a short pursuit that began at Interstate 24 & Lone Oak Road and ended near Bleich Road.

According to public reports, Mr. Grant failed to yield to a deputy during a traffic stop for speeding and an equipment violation. He was eventually arrested after striking a school zone sign. He was booked into the McCracken County Regional Jail on several charges including:

Fleeing or Evading Police (2nd Degree – Motor Vehicle)

Disregarding Traffic Control Device

Careless Driving

Criminal Mischief (1st Degree)

Possession of Marijuana and Drug Paraphernalia

Rear License Not Illuminated

No Insurance

I am requesting the following records:

Arrest report and citation

Body-worn camera and/or dashcam footage from the pursuit

911 call recordings, if any

Booking information, mugshot

Incident and supplemental reports

Evidence logs

Any additional documentation filed in the case

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Demarqeyun Cox ATV Incident – Texarkana PD (March 25, 2025)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Demarqeyun Cox ATV Incident – Texarkana PD (March 25, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to the arrest of Demarqeyun Marquize Cox, age 24, who was taken into custody by Texarkana Police following a vehicle rampage on March 25, 2025. According to public reports, Cox was accused of driving a mini four-wheeler erratically, ramming into at least two parked Teslas at the Texarkana College campus before fleeing. The suspect reportedly led officers on a foot chase before being detained.

The records I request include:

Body-worn camera footage from all officers involved

Dashcam footage

Arrest report and offense/incident report

911 call audio or transcripts

Radio communications and dispatch logs

Mugshot and booking report

Any available surveillance or supplemental documentation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani
